titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.sponsor:
The adult education holdings are collectively known as the
.

list.item: 7 Jun 2006 - alpha listing/index created, converted to EAD (MRR)

did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: University of the State of New York

did.abstract: Pamphlets, journals, directories, newsletters, etc related to adult and continuing education, from the United States as well as from countries from Finland to Thailand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Continuing Education Pamphlet Collection is a truly comprehensive selection of adult and continuing education related publications from around the world. Organizations represented include the Adult Education Association of the Unites States (AEA/USA), the Council on the Continuing Education Unit (CCEU), the Center for the Study of Liberal Ed. for Adults (CSLEA), EDUCAFRICA , the European Centre for Development of Vocational Training, International Council on Adult Education (ICAE), L'ICEA, UNESCO, and the Worker's Education Association (WEA). Countries represented range from Argentina to Japan to Zimbabwe. The content includes pamphlets, journals, periodicals, directories, newsletters, monographs, and more.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection itself is not arranged in any particular order. The finding aid is arranged alphabetically, with cross-references; every attempt has been made to note and reference related material, but the researcher would be wise to check under variant names of people and/or organizations as well as under their acronyms to ensure finding all relevant material.
A box listing, without cross-references, is also provided at the end of this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The library holds a considerable number of collections related to adult and continuing education. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the U.S. Department of Education; University of the State of New York; Roger Hiemstra.
